article.headline: Charlotte 82, Coppin St 65
article.story: LARAMIE, Wyo. (AP) -- Coppin State was smart enough not to give Charlotte's Curtis Withers any easy looks in the lane. Their mistake was leaving De'Angelo Alexander open on the perimeter. Alexander had four 3-pointers and 22 points to lead the 49ers (1-0) to an 82-65 victory over Coppin State (0-1) Sunday night in the first round of the Black Coaches Association Invitational. "We started off going inside, and that is what opened up the outside jump shots," Alexander said. Open them up? Did they ever. Alexander hit a 3-pointer to start the scoring, and Leemire Goldwire added two more in Charlotte's 11-4 opening run. "We started out playing a really good first half," Charlotte coach Bobby Lutz said. "A couple of defensive mistakes, but I think we played real well." Leading 23-15 midway through the first half, the 49ers went on a 15-2 run capped by Drayton's 3-pointer from the top of the key that made it 38-17. After that, Coppin State never got within single digits. The 49ers led 46-28 at halftime after hitting better than 61 percent from the field in the first half, including five of 12 3-pointers. "We came out sluggish, a little scared," Coppin State coach Ronald "Fang" Mitchell said. "If they had come out passive like we did, then they would have had a basketball game," Mitchell said. "But they didn't come out passive. They attacked us." Withers added 17 points and 10 rebounds for Charlotte, and E.J. Drayton scored 10. Darryl Proctor led Coppin State with 19 points, and Darryl Roberts scored 17. Charlotte will play Northwestern in the semifinals; Coppin State will play Lehigh. Lutz also was pleased to see his team had outrebounded Coppin State 50-30 -- and particularly pleased with Charlotte's 36 defensive rebounds, a point of emphasis for the 49ers this season. "That's an area that we -- let me rephrase. We have been a very good offensive rebounding team; we have not been as good of a defensive rebounding team," Lutz said. "That's something we've worked on. Proctor opened the second half with a pair of baskets, pulling the Eagles within 46-32, but that was the closest they would get. Charlotte responded by going inside to Withers, who scored six of the next eight points for the 49ers. A 3-pointer from Alexander made it 57-37 with 15:15 left.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).
